Pre-Game Insights: India is riding high on a 47-run victory over AFG and is eyeing a fifth consecutive win in T20 World Cup meetings against BAN.
Leading the charge are the formidable duo of Rohit Sharma (454 runs) and Yuzvendra Chahal (9 wickets) for India.
Others: The match will take place at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, North Sound, Antigua on Saturday, June 22, 2024, at 8 pm IST.
Bangladesh enters the fray after a 28-run loss by DLS method to Australia and sits rock-bottom on the Group 1 table.
